metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8128 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
LibTIFF prior to 4.0.4, as used in Apple iOS before 8.4 and OS X before 10.10.4 and other products, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write) via a crafted TIFF image.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8128` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.2
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.2
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.2
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

Bug: http://bugzilla.maptools.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2499 (thumbnail and tiffcmp) [not fixed yet in CVS HEAD]

notes.Note: mdeslaur> bug 2499 is in Debian patch called CVE-2014-8128-5.patch CVE-2014-8128-5.patch caused a regression and was backed out of USN-2553-2. See LP: #1439186

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.2').
